etomica.math

Class SpecialFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.math.SpecialFunctions

  • public final class SpecialFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
    Static-method library of various functions

      static double erfc(double x)
      consider using org.apache.commons.math3.special.Erf.erfc() this method is substantially faster (~10x - 100x), but only accurate to ~10^-7 Complementary error function, computed using the approximant 7.1.26 of Abramowitz & Stegun.

      • lp

      • nbin

        protected static int nbin
        Returns the Wigner 3j symbol associated with coupling angular momenta in quantum mechanics. Reference for code that is commented out: (this code is not much robust) 1. http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Wigner3j-Symbol.html 2. http://massey.dur.ac.uk/umk/files/python/wigner.py Robust code taken from Bartolomei's pes-mrci.f file located at /usr/users/rsubrama/Desktop/Acads/Phd/oxygen/Bartolomei2010/ Currently only works for all 6 inputs being integers and not half integers

      • binom

        protected static double[][] binom

    • Method Detail

      • erfc

        public static double erfc(double x)
        consider using org.apache.commons.math3.special.Erf.erfc() this method is substantially faster (~10x - 100x), but only accurate to ~10^-7 Complementary error function, computed using the approximant 7.1.26 of Abramowitz & Stegun. Defined for x >= 0

      • factorial

        public static long factorial(int n)
        The factorial function, n!
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n < 0

      • lnFactorial

        public static double lnFactorial(int n)

      • sgn

        public static double sgn(double x)
        The sign function, returning -1 if x < 0, zero if x == 0, and +1 if x > 0.

      • lnGamma

        public static double lnGamma(double x)
        Returns the ln(gamma), the natural logarithm of the gamma function. Lanczos approximation, with precision ~15 digits coefficients from GSL (GNU Scientific Library) with g=7

      • gamma

        public static double gamma(double x)

      • gammaQ

        public static double gammaQ(double a,
                            double x)
        Normalized incomplete gamma function, equal to Integrate[Exp[-t] t^(a-1),{t,x,Infinity}]/Gamma[a]

      • confluentHypergeometric1F1

        public static double confluentHypergeometric1F1(double a,
                                                double c,
                                                double xin)
        The confluent hypergeometric function, usually given the symbol 1F1. This is a porting to Java of the function hyperg_1F1_luke in the file specfunc/hyperg_1F1.c from the GNU Scientific Library. For algorithm, see [Luke, Algorithms for the Computation of Mathematical Functions, p.182] (GSL license info to be added) GSL home page is http://www.gnu.org/software/gsl/

      • calcLegendrePolynomial

        public static double calcLegendrePolynomial(int n,
                                            double x)
        Calculates Pn(x), Legendre polynomial of order n for the given input value. The method method makes use of a recursive method to calculate the return value, so calling the method for all n in a sequence should not be much more expensive than the call for the highest order.

      • wigner3J

        public static double wigner3J(int j1,
                              int j2,
                              int j3,
                              int m1,
                              int m2,
                              int m3)

      • pascal

        protected static void pascal()

      • besselI

        public static double besselI(int order,
                             double x)
        Calculates the modified bessel function of the first kind (I) for a given order and the variable x. Right now works only for integer orders. Reference: http://mathworld.wolfram.com/ModifiedBesselFunctionoftheFirstKind.html
        Parameters:
        order -
        x -
        Returns:
        double y

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
